rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An establishment where customers can play arcade games, especially video games and pinball games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Amusement Arcade

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An enterprise that allows clients to bet on sporting and other events and pays out on the basis of established odds.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Bookmaker

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An establishment that contains various gambling games where customers can and bet money.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casino

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of all casino games. These games are divided into roughly two categories: table games, like blackjack, craps, and roulette that are operated by a live dealer(s), and non-table games like slot machines, pachinko, and video poker.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Casino Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of people or organizations that design games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Designer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Virtual property relating an mso:games.designer to the mso:games.game(s) the agent has designed.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games Designed

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An addition or supplement to an existing game that provides new scenarios or materials to the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Expansion

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links an expansion pack to the original game that the expansion is based on.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A Boolean property that indicates whether the original game is required to use the given expansion pack.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Standalone

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A business operation that provides gambling services to clients, either by providing games of chance on which money can be wagered or by facilitating betting transactions.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Gambling Enterprise

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description:
A structured, competitive activity where the aim is recreation or mental stimulation. Note that games, unlike sports, do not require a significant amount of physical exertion.
Things that are a game:
## Board games (e.g. Chess, Scrabble, Trivial Pursuit, Cashflow 101).
## Dice games (e.g. Dice 10000, Liar???s Dice, Greed).
## Tile-based games (e.g. Mahjong, Dominoes, Hive).
## Playing card games (e.g. Solitaire, All-fours, Cuarenta, Kings).
## Collectible and trading card games (e.g. Conan Collectible Card Game, Pok??mon Trading Card Game, Fight Klub TCG).
## Miniature wargames (e.g. Necromunda, Warmachine, BlitzkriegCommander).
## Role-playing games (e.g. Dungeons and Dragons, GURPS, Sorcerer).
## Pencil and paper games (e.g. Hangman, Race Game, SOS).
## Traditional children???s games and playground games (e.g. Follow the Leader, Hopscotch, Leapfrog).
## Games which also allow existing games to be played in new or different ways. (e.g. Cities and Knights of Catan, Shards of Alara).
## Written works that are game expansions (e.g. Heroes of Horror, GURPS Infinite Worlds, Dwellers of the Forbidden City).
## Video games, audio games and hand-held electronic games (e.g. The sims, Super Mario Bros, Call of Duty: Black Ops).
Things that are NOT a game:
## Sports (e.g. Basketball, Bowling, Tug of war, Marathon) ## Use mso:sports.sport for these.
## Genre of games (e.g. adventure board game, role-playing game, abstract strategy game) ## Use mso:games.genre for these.
## Puzzles (e.g. Rubik???s Cube, N-puzzle, Sudoku).
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to other, independent games that are based on the original game, e.g. the various local versions of Monopoly are derivatives of the original game of Monopoly. Note that a derivative game, unlike an expansion pack, is a modification of rather than a supplement to an existing game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Derivative Games

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property that links a derivative game to the original game that the derivative is based on, e.g. the various local versions of Monopoly are derivatives of the original game of Monopoly. Note that a derivative game, unlike an expansion pack, is a modification of rather than a supplement to an existing game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Original Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to the person or organization that conceived the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Designer

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links an original game to an addition or supplement that provides new scenarios or materials to the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Expansions

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a game to an entity that serves as a descriptor for the topic of the game, e.g. vampires or World War II.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Subjects

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to a standard descriptor for the kind of game, e.g. word game, war game or abstract strategy game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to the date when the game was first released.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Introduced

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to the oldest recommended age in years for players of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Age

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to an upper bound in minutes for the expected duration of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Maximum Playing Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to the youngest recommended age in years for players of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minimum Age

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to a range indicating the minimum and maximum number of players of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Players

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property linking a game to the geographic location where the game evolved or was invented.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Origin

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to a lower bound in minutes for the expected duration of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Minimum Playing Time

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to the company that is responsible for developing and releasing the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Publisher

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that links a game to a competency that is required by players of the game, e.g. counting and observation.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Required Skills

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An establishment where clients can play games of a specific type or of various types.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Facility

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains standard descriptors for kinds of game, e.g. word game, war game or abstract strategy game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Genre

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains particular events of randomly determining winner(s) of a lottery, e.g. the drawing on February 3rd, 2015 for the New York Lottery.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Drawing

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery drawing to the odds of winning any prize in the drawing.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drawing Odds

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery drawing to information about the prizes awarded in the drawing.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drawing Prizes

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery drawing to a description of the winning number for the drawing.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Winning Number

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing recurring games of chance, e.g. lottery games, e.g. Powerball, Megamillions, New York Lottery, etc., where one buys a ticket for an opportunity to participate in a random drawing that awards a percentage of the ticket revenue.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery game, e.g. the New York Lottery, to a particular drawing of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Drawing

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery game to a day of the week on which drawings of the game are held.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Drawing Days

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery game to a location where the lottery game can be played, i.e. where tickets to the lottery are sold.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Location

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery game to the overall odds of winning any prize in drawings of the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Overall Odds

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a lottery game to a time of the day when drawings of the game are held.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Time of Day

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that collects information about the prizes awarded in a particular lottery drawing, viz. the type of match required to win the prize, the prize amount, and the odds of winning the prize.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Prize

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the amount of money awarded to someone holding a lottery ticket satisfying the given match type.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Match Amount

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the odds of winning the given prize.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Match Odds

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that specifies the kind of match required between the ticket and the drawing in order to win the given prize.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Lottery Match Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for types of playing card decks, e.g. standard 52-card deck, pinochle deck, and Italian deck. Typically types of card decks differ from each other in the types of suits and the number of cards.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Playing Card Deck Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking a type of deck of cards to a game that can be played with the deck.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Card Games

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Primary entity representing the collection of card games. Card games are those games using playing cards as the main object of play. These include games played with a traditional deck of cards, like bridge, gin, and poker, and those games like Dominion, that are played with a game-specific deck of cards.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Playing card game

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a playing card game to the kind of card deck used in the game, e.g. standard 52-card deck, pinochle deck, and Italian deck.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Deck Type

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property relating a playing card game to the number of cards in the deck used to play the game.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Number of Cards

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A property that relates a playing card game to a descriptor indicating the direction in which turns are taken in the game, e.g. clockwise and counter-clockwise.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Play Direction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type containing standard descriptors for the direction in which turns are played in the given game, e.g. clockwise and counter-clockwise.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Play Direction

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property linking a direction of play to a game that uses the direction of play.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Card Games

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A facility where games involving cue sticks and billiard balls can be played.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Pool and Billiards Parlor

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A type that contains companies that are responsible for developing and releasing games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Game Publisher

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: A virtual property relating a publisher of games to a game that the company has published.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Games Published

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: An establishment where patrons can play games of table tennis, a game involving paddles and small plastic balls that is based on the sport of tennis.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Table Tennis Facility

rdf:Description.mso:type.object.description: Retail outlets that specialize in selling toys and games.
rdf:Description.mso:type.object.name: Toy and Game Store
